13 Ireland Parameters To show that I can work with parameterization in my Markdowns, I made a parameterized markdown with data about COVID-19 cases and COVID-19 related deaths. The data used for this markdown was from the ECDC website. To start, I downloaded this data from the website and read it in in RStudio. covid19_data <- read_csv(here::here("Data/Data_raw/covid19_data.csv")) Then, I changed the value ‘month’ to a numeric variable, so it’d be easier to use later on in the graphs. I also set all three parameters manually, because Bookdown does not support parameters. covid19_data <- covid19_data %>% mutate(month = month.name[as.numeric(month)]) #country <- params$country #year <- params$year #months <- params$month parameters <- list() parameters$country <- "Ireland" parameters$year <- 2020 parameters$month <- "August" covid19_data_filtered <- covid19_data %>% filter(year %in% parameters$year, countriesAndTerritories %in% parameters$country, month %in% parameters$month) I created a graph to show the COVID-19 cases per day for a specific month, and I also created a graph for the amount of COVID-19 related deaths per day for a specific month. In this markdown, I did this for Ireland. covid19_data_filtered %>% group_by(day, month, year) %>% filter(countriesAndTerritories == parameters$country & year == parameters$year & month == parameters$month) %>% ggplot(aes(x = day, y = cases)) + geom_point() + scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1, 31, 1)) + labs(title = paste0("COVID-19 cases in ", parameters$country, ", ", parameters$month, " ", parameters$year), x = "Day", y = "COVID-19 cases") covid19_data %>% group_by(day, month, year) %>% filter(countriesAndTerritories == parameters$country & year == parameters$year & month == parameters$month) %>% ggplot(aes(x = day, y = deaths)) + geom_point() + scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(1, 31, 1)) + labs(title = paste0("COVID-19 related deaths in ", parameters$country, ", ", parameters$month, " ", parameters$year), x = "Day" , y = "COVID-19 related deaths") For a parameterized HTML on the COVID-19 cases and deaths in Spain, April 2021, click here For a parameterized HTML on the COVID-19 cases and deaths in Austria, February 2022, click here
